title: Zelenskiy says he is open to elections if US ensures security
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday he was prepared to hold elections within three months if the U.S. and Kyiv’s other allies could ensure the security of the vote.

title: Train delays reported along the Main Line
byline: Trains operating along the main line are currently experiencing delays, Sri Lanka Railways has stated.

title: Russia sends 35 tonnes of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka
byline: Russia has sent a planeload of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka after the country was struck by Cyclone Ditwah in late November, Russia’s RIA news agency reported early on Wednesday, citing Shobini Gunasekera, Sri Lanka’s ambassador to Moscow.

title: Floods cannot be allowed to continue to disrupt lives of Colombo residents: PM Harini
byline: Floods cannot be allowed to continue to disrupt the lives of the people of Colombo, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Heavy showers above 100 mm likely in Northern, North-Central and Eastern provinces today
byline: Showers or thundershowers are expected in the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Central, Southern and Uva provinces today (10), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Sri Lanka secures US$ 30 million World Bank loan for renewable energy projects
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has arranged a loan of US$ 30 million from the International Development Association of the World Bank Group to finance the implementation of the secure, affordable and sustainable energy for Sri Lanka Project.

title: Taliban detains 4 men for dressing up as “Peaky Blinders” characters, gives them rehabilitation
byline: Four young men were detained by Afghanistan’s Taliban authorities and put into a rehabilitation program for walking around in public dressed up as their favorite characters from the hit British drama “Peaky Blinders.”

title: Google Maps to provide real-time update on Sri Lanka’s main roads – Minister
byline: Google Maps has commenced updating real-time information across 12,000 kilometers of the country’s main roads, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake has stated.

title: Over 50,000 tourists arrive in first eight days of December
byline: A total of 50,222 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in December, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Individual arrested over theft of telecom transmission cables in Rambukkana
byline: An individual has been arrested in connection with the theft of cables installed on a telecommunication transmission tower located in Yatagama, Rambukkana, police stated.

title: Youth succumbs following sudden explosion at fireworks factory in Katana
byline: A youth has died following a sudden explosion at a fireworks manufacturing factory in Kimbulapitiya, Katana, police stated.

title: Britain sanctions Russian, Chinese entities over disinfo, cyber threats
byline: Britain on Tuesday (Dec 9) sanctioned entities it accused of distorting information in favour of Russia as well as two Chinese companies for alleged cyber activities against the United Kingdom and its allies.

title: Elon Musk’s X says would comply with Australia’s Social Media ban
byline: Elon Musk’s X has announced it would comply with Australia’s world-leading crackdown banning under-16s from social media.

title: Landslide in Bogahapathana, no injuries or casualties reported
byline: A landslide has been reported in Bogahapathana, Meegahakiula.

title: H-1B visa appointments postponed for many Indians amid US’ Social Media rules
byline: The US State Department’s new social media vetting policy has triggered massive disruptions for H-1B visa applicants in India as many appointments have been postponed to next year. The US Embassy in India issued an advisory to the visa applicants on Tuesday night.

title: “Rebuilding Sri Lanka” Fund receives Rs. 1,893 million thus far
byline: The “Rebuilding Sri Lanka” programme, initiated to restore the country following the damage caused by Cyclone “Ditwah,” has received a total of Rs. 1,893 million in funding from domestic sources, overseas Sri Lankans, and various institutions, the Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma has stated.

title: Ex-Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal and three others acquitted in Greek Bond case
byline: Former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal and three others have been acquitted from the case pertaining to the purchase of Greek Bonds in 2012.

title: Family dog assists in locating bodies of seven victims in Ambokka landslide
byline: Highlands surrounding the Ambokka village within the Pallepola Divisional Secretariat area in Matale, have reportedly become increasingly unstable following recent heavy rains.

title: Homeowners in landslide-prone areas provided with reports on risk level: NBRO
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has extended landslide warnings issued to several areas based on current ground conditions and weather forecasts.

title: Heavy vehicles barred from using road over Kotmale Dam: Mahaweli Authority
byline: Heavy vehicles have been barred from using the road over the Kotmale Dam, the Mahaweli Development Authority (MDA) has announced.

title: Case against Yoshitha and grandmother adjourned pending Daisy Forrest’s medical report
byline: The Attorney General informed the Colombo High Court today (10) that Daisy Forrest, the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa and a defendant in a case filed under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, is scheduled to undergo a psychiatric medical report tomorrow by the Colombo Judicial Medical Officer.

title: Google Maps begins updating Sri Lanka’s road network – Minister
byline: Google Maps has commenced updating information pertaining Sri Lanka’s road network covering around 12,000 kilometers, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake has stated.

title: Significant flooding reported after heavy rainfall in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia
byline: Jeddah, Saudi Arabia has experienced heavy rainfall that has led to significant flooding and traffic congestion across the city.

title: Kolonna Pradeshiya Sabha’s budget defeated for the second time
byline: The annual budget of the Kolonna Pradeshiya Sabha, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated for the second time.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara Districts.

title: Australia and UNFPA partner to protect women and girls in cyclone-affected Sri Lanka
byline: Australia and the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) have partnered to deliver urgent humanitarian assistance to protect women and girls across Sri Lanka, affected by catastrophic floods and landslides triggered by Cyclone Ditwah, one of the most devastating climate-related disasters to strike the island nation in recent years.

title: Deepavali inscribed on UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage list
byline: Deepavali — the festival of lights — was on Wednesday (December 10, 2025) inscribed on the UNESCO’s Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity, sparking celebrations to mark the earning of the coveted tag.

title: UAE continues to send aid to assist flood-hit Sri Lanka
byline: The UAE’s eight humanitarian aid aircraft has arrived in Sri Lanka on Tuesday in efforts to support the country following deadly floods and landslides.

title: Notice on reopening preschools and early childhood development centers
byline: All preschools and early childhood development centers that were closed due to the emergency disaster situation and are now deemed safe to resume operations will be reopened from 16 December 2025.

title: Amended timetable of 2025 A/L examination released
byline: The Ministry of Education has decided that the subjects of the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination which were postponed due to the adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka will now be conducted from January 12 to January 20, 2026.

title: Russia’s first aircraft carrying 35 tons of humanitarian aid arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Russia has dispatched a consignment of 35 metric tons of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka following the impact of Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Gihan Kulatunga sworn in as Supreme Court Judge
byline: Court of Appeal Justice K. M. Gihan Himanshu Kulatunga has been sworn in as a Justice of the Supreme Court before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (10) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Thriposha company hands over Rs. 100 mln in dividends to Treasury
byline: Sri Lanka Thriposha Limited has General Treasury handed over a sum of Rs. 100 million to the General Treasury as dividends.

title: Greek Bond case: Ex-CBSL Governor Cabraal released
byline: Former Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal has been released from the case pertaining to the 2012 purchase of Greek Bonds, subject to conditions, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Kandy-Nuwara Eliya Road restored - District Secretary
byline: Nuwara Eliya District Secretary Thushari Tennakoon said that four access roads, including the main Kandy-Nuwara Eliya road, which were blocked due to earth slips and landslides due to the recent heavy rainfall, have now been restored.

title: Microsoft and MillenniumIT ESP to support data collection on damage caused by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma, stated that the Department of National Planning has launched a programme to collect information and data on businesses and properties damaged by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Two buildings collapse in Morocco’s Fez killing 22 people
byline: At least 22 people were killed and 16 others injured overnight when two adjacent buildings collapsed in Fez, one of Morocco’s oldest cities, the prosecutor said on Wednesday.
